intro: Leucanthemum vulgare var. sinuatum, commonly known as the sinuous leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its white to pale yellow flowers with a central yellow disk, surrounded by ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal and stem leaves that are lobed or toothed. It thrives in well-drained soils and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for gardens and naturalized areas. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
